title: More features needed for meetings
text:
I want to be able to turn off seeing myself when speaking. 

I want to be able to see people when sharing my display as I often switch between windows or apps and if I share a screen everyone sees themselves in a delay. How can I share my screen while seeing my audience so they don‚Äôt see themselves.  Zoom has more options like this that I like.

text: There‚Äôs always room for improvement, i.e font styles, copy from and paste just to name a few.

title: Phantom Notification Badge
text: I actually like Teams. But the phantom notification badge is incredibly annoying. I‚Äôve tried signing out and back in, deleting and reinstalling, every trick I could find online. Still says seven on the badge when there‚Äôs nothing. Ugh.

title: Love!!
text: I can work from anywhere with this app. I love it

text: I don‚Äôt spend a lot of time on the app but love that my team can reach me while I‚Äôm not at my desk; which is frequently!

title: Adaptive Cards don‚Äôt work

title: Microsoft can do better!! Shifts don‚Äôt sync
text: I like the concept for meetings, but I can‚Äôt seem to get the shifts to load or sync properly. I have to clear the data just to view my teams schedule and most of the open shifts don‚Äôt appear.. Horrible communication between the app and the desktop.. Trying to manage a new team and super frustrated!!

title: Bug in application

text: I love how the way that you get new friends

title: Good app
text: The calendar section needs work.

title: Volume
text: Only issue so far has been the volume, as when I put it on speaker, I can barely hear the other person‚Äôs conversation. I end have the volume at max.  Otherwise a one on one isn‚Äôt to bad to IM at least.

title: Need access to my local network???
text: Why can‚Äôt I join teams meetings without enabling access to my local network? You have access to my wifi and that is all you need. Looks like in version 5.20.2 you accidentally allowed people to join meetings without enabling access to local network. In version 5.21.1 you are enforcing the same again! WHY????

title: Add this please
text: Good for school and all, but this is not what this review is about. Microsoft Teams NEEDS an update where you can undelete a conversation you had with another person. Please. I am in pain because I accidentally erased a chat I had with a friend and can‚Äôt recover it. The chat is over 1 year old, filled with important messages. If I cannot recover it, I will lose my mind. Help. Please. I need that chat. Apart from that, best app for school. Would 100% recommend. Do not change this negatively. Please add that feature. I‚Äôm begging you.

title: Compatible
text: Easy to work with for the work I am doing.

title: Audio via iPad Speakers, won‚Äôt utilize headset
text: I use an old-fashioned wired headset (the old Apple standard 1/8‚Äù jack white in-ear wired headset with microphone that came with many generations of the iPhone), this release of Teams will not work with it, insists on using the iPad speakers (and also microphone I believe) and there is no way to switch it. This is unacceptable (and frankly it‚Äôs also an indictment of Apple as it shouldn‚Äôt even be possible for an app to do this). Please fix this ASAP.

title: App is broken. Minimizing kicks you out
text: Not sure which update broke the app. But now when you try to do something else on the phone while in a meeting. The call stays connected but you are kicked from the meeting.  This is very disruptive to any workflow.

title: Great if you like to wait for Update
text: I LOVE how Teams constantly updates the app which always takes upwards of 10-20 minutes during where I can‚Äôt use the app at all. Absolutely loving waiting to join a meeting when Teams suddenly decides to updates itself.

title: Tell your boss to use a better program
text: Everything feels clunky and breaks all the time.

title: Latest version broken with Bluetooth headphones
text: Ever since a recent update, Teams only works with my AirPods about 20% of the time. It‚Äôs completely inconsistent and the connection seems to work, but no audio comes through. I hope this gets resolved soon!

title: Buggy and crashes regularly
text: If I wasn‚Äôt forced by my university to use this app, I really wouldn‚Äôt even consider using it. Makes me feel like I‚Äôm working on an early 2000‚Äôs web browser.

title: Great but buggy
text: Teams has been one game changer for my companies communication and structure but unfortunately I get a lot of bugs here and there where I have to close out of the mobile app or pc app and re open it. I also have issues opening files within teams on mobile devices.

title: Excellent
text: Easy to handle. I like it

title: SMS texting
text: Needs this service- receive and send messages.

title: Uploading
text: It would be nice if you were able to upload more than one photo at a time. I use teams for work and having to go one picture at a time is tedious and frustrating. Same with opening pictures. Why can‚Äôt I click through them like a slideshow? It would be nice to swipe through them like how they are in my camera roll. Other than that teams is nice.

title: Crashed before interview
text: As the title suggests, the app crashed and froze right before a job interview. I ended up needing to email the people interviewing me and telling them of my issue, and the meeting is now supposed to be rescheduled. It took me an hour to get the app working again, where I had to completely uninstall and reinstall, then log back in, which for some reason KEPT FREEZING! Zoom is better, I‚Äôve never had these issues with Zoom. I‚Äôve had many other issues with Teams, and truly believe that you should not use it.

title: Terrible
text: I had to use this for a class and if I had to do anything else on my phone I had to exit the call and rejoin to get video. Do not recommend

title: Picture in Picture doesn‚Äôt work as a guest on iOS 16.6.1
text: Please fix asap

title: Buggy
text:
App has become literally unusable. 

App calendar won‚Äôt load. I have to set up the app each time I open it (‚Äúwelcome to teams - get stared‚Äù ‚Äúwe‚Äôd like to share optional diagnostic data - accept decline‚Äù etc).  Annoying, but not the end of the world. 

The problem is now I‚Äôm getting a ‚Äúsomething went wrong‚Äù notification every 3 seconds which forces me to sign out and sign in again. Until the notification comes back up pulling me into an endless cycle. Meaning I can never actually get inside the app. 

I had to give up and use the call in number so I could at least listen to my meeting at work.

title: Use something else
text: I have to use Teams for an upcoming meeting and I have been trying to just create a profile and it glitches out every 30 seconds and won‚Äôt let me do it. This app is garbage and there are far better things to use.

title: Teams rapidly innovative
text: Impressed with Teams integrated innovation!

title: MS Teams - mobile app is very good
text:
The mobile app works well.   
It‚Äôs quick and allows me to have similar functionality from my phone as from my laptop.   
Video meetings, calendar updates, chat messages with colleagues are all very easy.

title: Essential
text: We use Teams for work so I am on it constantly. I love the features and it‚Äôs easy to use. However, using on my PC is so much better - the mobile app isn‚Äôt the greatest. It glitches and crashes constantly and I‚Äôve had days at a time that I can‚Äôt take Teams calls on my phone.

title: TEAMS
text: It is so user friendly. My job picked a good app !

title: Amazing!!
text: What a great app!

title: Chat placement
text: Chats should be accessible without losing your place in a file folder to task list. Switching between uses should save your last position

title: Please update so that more than one account could be logged in
text: Please update so that more than one account could be logged in

title: Reliable
text: Reliable platform for day to day communication

title: Camera comes on accidentally too easily
text: If I‚Äôm in a Teams meeting and have my hands full, I‚Äôd like to be able to put my phone in my pocket. The problem is this tends to turn the camera on. This is not desirable if in a large meeting with bad camera angles. I should be able to lock my phone in a way that prevents the camera from coming on inadvertently.

title: iPhone issues
text: I only gave 3 stars because when I‚Äôm in a teams meeting and I switch out of the app, I can‚Äôt get back to the screen share. So basically, I am blind for the rest of the meeting. I need to be able to flip back and forth to see shared screen and checking other apps for data.

title: Invasive. It‚Äôs like a virus
text: I had to delete teams just to stop getting notifications on vacation. I set things to out of office/do not disturb and did not make an exception for teams on my focus mode. Yet it still blows up my phone. I have my laptop set to no notifications at all, yet in the bottom corner of my screen teams let‚Äôs me know that it‚Äôs better than my personal settings and refuses to listen. If you have teams, you can‚Äôt take a vacation because teams thinks it doesn‚Äôt need to listen to your settings. It‚Äôs like having a two year old with no boundaries with you at all times. I hate teams so much because of this.

title: I shouldn‚Äôt have to download an app
text: It clearly works fine on browser and you admit it will work okay but you refuse to let me actually use it by throwing redirects at me whenever you detect I‚Äôm on a phone. Just make a competent web app and don‚Äôt force people to download an app please

title: Update Required Too Often
text: It seems like every time I go to send a screenshot through teams on my iPad, I am forced to update the app in order to send the screenshot. This is cumbersome and seemingly unnecessary. Please change this requirement.

title: Terrible in iOS 17
text: After update to iOS 17 on iPhone 15 pro, can no longer minimize meetings. It just cancels the screen share, audio still works but can‚Äôt go back to screen. Also can‚Äôt switch to phone handset, it forces it back to speaker which you can‚Äôt turn down. Terrible
